Even though COVID-19 has not, in general, hurt young children and college-age students nearly as much as older or more vulnerable Americans, there is some health risk. 

But in my view the greater risk is not going back to school.
The question before the country today is not about whether to go back to school or college or child care or work, but how to do it safely.

While states and communities continue to take action to help keep people safe, nothing was more disruptive to American life‚Äîand nothing would head it back toward normalcy‚Äîthan for those 135,000 public and private schools and 6,000 colleges to reopen safely this Fall.
Add the lost sports seasons and once in a lifetime graduation ceremonies. Then there were unprecedented dilemmas for administrators and inadequate school budgets.
Add to the casualties the teachers who weren‚Äôt prepared to teach remotely and the working parents who suddenly had school children at home and who weren‚Äôt prepared to home school.
Among the casualties of COVID-19 are the 75 million students who were sent home from schools and colleges in March.

Reducing our dependence on plastic, reigning in plastic production from fossil fuels, and conserving nature must all be integral in our strategy to halt climate change. The inclusion of these efforts in the House climate action plan is big news.

RT @HouseScience RELEASE: Chairwoman @RepEBJ Applauds Climate Crisis Committee Action Plan
https://science.house.gov/news/press-releases/chairwoman-johnson-applauds-climate-crisis-committee-action-plan

#BreakFreeFromPlastic is part of climate action because plastic production is a greenhouse gas super-polluter & getting rid of the waste creates emissions. Disadvantaged communities & communities of color often endure the worst effects of toxic pollution from plastic production.

Why is #30by30 in this plan? Because as humanity destroys nature at a devastating rate, we are speeding up emission of greenhouse gases, hurtling us toward a climate catastrophe. Scientists tell us that we must conserve at least 30 percent of our lands and waters by 2030.

Proud that #30by30 and the #BreakFreeFromPlastic Pollution Act are included in the House's climate action plan. If we want to fight climate change, we have to tackle it from all angles.
 
This is urgent. We must be bold.
